causes: Teutonic Order’s attempts to control the Prince-Bishopric of Warmia.
Bishop Nicholas von Tüngen’s alignment with Poland against Teutonic rule.
The weakening of the Teutonic Order following its defeat in the Thirteen Years’ War (1454–1466).
events_leading_up_to_war: The Second Peace of Thorn (1466) forced the Teutonic Order to recognize Polish overlordship over Royal Prussia.
The Teutonic Order refused to accept the Polish-nominated bishop in Warmia.
The Order launched military campaigns to regain Warmia’s independence from Polish influence.

result.territorial_changes: Warmia fully integrated into the Polish Crown’s sphere of influence.

major_battles.name: Siege of Lidzbark
major_battles.description: Polish forces besieged and captured the stronghold of Lidzbark, cutting off Teutonic supply lines.

major_battles.name: Battle of Heilsberg
major_battles.description: A decisive battle where Polish and Warmian forces crushed Teutonic reinforcements.

texts.name: Chronicles of Jan Długosz
texts.details: Detailed accounts of the conflict from a Polish perspective.

texts.name: Teutonic Military Records
texts.details: Documents on Teutonic troop movements and mercenary payments.

archaeological_evidence.description: Recovered swords, crossbows, and armor from battle sites in Warmia.
Damaged fortifications at Lidzbark and Heilsberg showing cannon fire impact.

political: Teutonic Order lost influence over Warmia permanently.
long_term_effects: Further decline of the Teutonic Order as a political and military force.
Contributed to the eventual transformation of the Teutonic State into the secular Duchy of Prussia.

military: Demonstrated the growing power of Poland over the Teutonic Order.
Marked one of the last medieval conflicts between religious orders and secular states.
political: Helped solidify Polish dominance over Royal Prussia and Warmia.
Weakened the legitimacy of military orders as territorial rulers.
cultural: Contributed to the decline of chivalric knighthood in Central Europe.
Affected the development of Prussian identity and Polish-German relations.
